post.author: Kelly J Lee
post.content:
회사내 포스팅입니다.
HR person이 개인적으로도 부탁하는거라서 포스팅해봅니다.
혹시 관심 있으시면 아래 이멜로 이력서 보내주세요.
제가 HR로 forwarding하겠습니다.
jklee3@hotmail.com

2 positions: 1 Web Developer
                 1 Application Developer
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Application Developer
Job Description

Trapeze seeks an experienced Web Applications Developer with a strong background in PHP and MySQL.

Toronto-based Trapeze Media (http://www.trapeze.com) is a leading interactive design and development firm, and was named Time Magazine’s "Cool Web" company in Canada. Trapeze works with a variety of exciting world-renown clients, including Procter & Gamble, Paramount Pictures, Disney, Microsoft, CBC and Nickelodeon.

Responsibilities

The Developer will work with design, development, project management and business development staff to deliver creative and well-implemented technology solutions to Trapeze clients. These duties will include:

Creating clean well-structured reusable code and optimized applications

Assisting in the authorship of proposals by preparing prototypes and specifications

Planning and implementing application architecture and data models

Meeting project deadlines and development goals while providing regular status reports and tracking production hours

Testing and debugging applications

Preparing detailed technical documentation during project implementation

Researching and prototyping new emergent technologies, and engaging in cross-training of other staff

Requirements

The successful applicant must possess a minimum of three years related industry experience with the following technologies:

PHP

MySQL

Macromedia Flash (2004/MX/8), including advanced ActionScript, component architecture and use of external data sources

HTML (incl. Macromedia Dreamweaver)

JavaScript

Sound Knowledge of Object-Oriented Methodology

PC / Mac flexibility


The following optional skills are considered of strong benefit:

Adobe Photoshop

Linux

Drupal and other content management systems

J2EE and other Java-based technologies


Key Attributes

Detail-oriented and accountable for deadlines and quality of work

Creates clean well-structured and documented code

Committed to extensibility and reusability

Can distil business requirements into technical solutions while retaining a sense of the "big picture"

Comfortable working in a team environment

Willing to work occasional off-hours when necessary


•        Job location is Downtown Toronto
•        Compensation: To be discussed in a telephone interview if applicant passes resume review process





WEB DEVELOPER

Trapeze seeks an experienced Flash / Web Developer with a strong background in cross-platform standards-compliant HTML, CSS and Flash.

Toronto-based Trapeze Media (http://www.trapeze.com) is a leading interactive design and development firm, and was named Time Magazine’s "Cool Web" company in Canada. Trapeze works with a variety of exciting world-renown clients, including Procter & Gamble, Paramount Pictures, Disney, Microsoft, CBC and Nickelodeon.

Responsibilities

The Flash / Web Developer will work with design, development, project management and business development staff to deliver creative and well-implemented technology solutions to Trapeze clients. These duties will include:

Creating clean well-structured reusable code and optimized applications

Creating rich well-conceptualized designs and accurately migrating them from comps to either Flash or HTML / CSS

Assisting in the authorship of proposals by preparing prototypes and specifications

Planning and implementing application architecture and data models

Meeting project deadlines and development goals while providing regular status reports and tracking production hours

Testing and debugging applications

Preparing detailed technical documentation during project implementation

Researching and prototyping new emergent technologies, and engaging in cross-training of other staff

Requirements

The successful applicant must possess a minimum of three years related industry experience with the following technologies:

Macromedia Flash 8

ActionScript 2.0 Object-Oriented Programming (good understanding of ActionScript 2.0 components, class structure, inheritance and use of external data sources)

HTML (incl. Macromedia Dreamweaver)

CSS

JavaScript

Adobe Photoshop

Strong visual design ability, with ability to effectively translate Photoshop designs into visually accurate code

PC / Mac flexibility

The following optional skills are considered of strong benefit:

PHP

MySQL

Linux

Drupal and other content management systems

Key Attributes

Detail-oriented and accountable for deadlines and quality of work

Creates clean well-structured and documented code

Committed to extensibility and reusability

Can distil business requirements into technical solutions while retaining a sense of the "big picture"

Comfortable working in a team environment

Willing to work occasional off-hours when necessary


•        Job location is Downtown Toronto
•        Compensation: To be discussed in a telephone interview if applicant passes resume review process
post.title: Internal Posting
